title: Relates to the definition of and mandatory DNA identification of designated offenders; appropriation
summary: Relates to the definition of and mandatory DNA identification of designated offenders; appropriates funds therefor.

       AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to the definition of  and
         DNA  designation  of designated offenders; and to amend the penal law,
         in relation to DNA identification of designated offenders; and  making
         an appropriation therefor

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 7 of section  995  of  the  executive  law,  as

   52  defined in section 260.25 of the penal law] FELONY DEFINED IN THE  PENAL
   53  LAW OR ANY MISDEMEANOR DEFINED IN THE PENAL LAW, OR A PERSON ADJUDICATED
   54  AND  SENTENCED  AS A YOUTHFUL OFFENDER PURSUANT TO ARTICLE SEVEN HUNDRED
   55  TWENTY OF THE CRIMINAL PROCEDURE LAW FOR ANY SUCH MISDEMEANOR OR FELONY,

       S. 693                              4

    1  OR A PERSON WHO IS REQUIRED TO REGISTER AS A SEX  OFFENDER  PURSUANT  TO
    2  ARTICLE SIX-C OF THE CORRECTION LAW.
    3    S  2.  Subdivision 3 of section 995-c of the executive law, as amended
    4  by chapter 576 of the laws of 2004, is amended to read as follows:
    5    3. (A) Any designated offender [subsequent to conviction and  sentenc-
    6  ing  for  a crime specified in subdivision seven of section nine hundred
    7  ninety-five of this article,] shall be  required  to  provide  a  sample
    8  appropriate  for DNA testing to determine identification characteristics
    9  specific to such person and to be included in a state DNA identification
   10  index pursuant to this article.
   11    (B) (I) IN THE CASE OF A DESIGNATED OFFENDER WHO  IS  SENTENCED  TO  A
   12  TERM OF IMPRISONMENT, SUCH SAMPLE SHALL BE COLLECTED BY THE PUBLIC SERV-
   13  ANT TO WHOSE CUSTODY THE DESIGNATED OFFENDER HAS BEEN COMMITTED.
   14    (II)  IN  THE CASE OF A DESIGNATED OFFENDER WHO IS SENTENCED TO A TERM
   15  OF PROBATION, INCLUDING A SENTENCE OF PROBATION IMPOSED  IN  CONJUNCTION
   16  WITH  A  SENTENCE  OF  IMPRISONMENT  WHEN  A SAMPLE HAS NOT ALREADY BEEN
   17  TAKEN, SUCH SAMPLE SHALL BE COLLECTED BY THE PROBATION DEPARTMENT SUPER-
   18  VISING THE DESIGNATED OFFENDER.
   19    (III) IN THE CASE OF A DESIGNATED OFFENDER  WHOSE  SENTENCE  DOES  NOT
   20  INCLUDE EITHER A TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OR A TERM OF PROBATION, THE COURT,
   21  OR IN THE CASE OF A PERSON REGISTERED AS A SEX OFFENDER ON OR BEFORE THE
   22  EFFECTIVE  DATE OF THIS SUBPARAGRAPH WHO HAS NOT HAD A DNA SAMPLE TAKEN,
   23  THE DIVISION OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE SERVICES, SHALL ORDER THAT  THE  DESIG-
   24  NATED  OFFENDER  REPORT  TO AN OFFICE OF THE SHERIFF OF THAT COUNTY, AND
   25  WHEN THE DESIGNATED OFFENDER DOES SO, SUCH SAMPLE SHALL BE COLLECTED  BY
   26  THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE.
   27    (IV)  IN  THE  CASE  OF  A  DESIGNATED SEX OFFENDER WHO IS REQUIRED TO
   28  REGISTER AS A SEX OFFENDER PURSUANT TO ARTICLE SIX-C OF  THE  CORRECTION
   29  LAW AS A RESULT OF A CONVICTION OBTAINED IN A FOREIGN JURISDICTION ON OR
   30  AFTER  THE  EFFECTIVE  DATE  OF  THIS SUBPARAGRAPH, SUCH SAMPLE SHALL BE
   31  COLLECTED BY THE PROBATION DEPARTMENT OF THE COUNTY IN WHICH THE  DESIG-
   32  NATED OFFENDER RESIDES.
   33    (V)  NOTHING  IN THIS PARAGRAPH SHALL PROHIBIT THE COLLECTION OF A DNA
   34  SAMPLE FROM A DESIGNATED OFFENDER BY ANY COURT OFFICIAL, STATE OR  LOCAL
   35  CORRECTION  OFFICIAL  OR  EMPLOYEE,  PROBATION  OFFICER, PAROLE OFFICER,
   36  POLICE OFFICER, PEACE OFFICER, OR OTHER  PUBLIC  SERVANT  WHO  HAS  BEEN
   37  NOTIFIED  BY  THE DIVISION OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE SERVICES THAT SUCH DESIG-
   38  NATED OFFENDER HAS NOT PROVIDED A DNA SAMPLE. UPON NOTIFICATION  BY  THE
   39  DIVISION OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE SERVICES THAT A DESIGNATED OFFENDER HAS NOT
   40  PROVIDED  A  DNA  SAMPLE, SUCH COURT OFFICIAL, STATE OR LOCAL CORRECTION
   41  OFFICIAL OR EMPLOYEE, PROBATION OFFICER, PAROLE OFFICER, POLICE OFFICER,
   42  PEACE OFFICER OR OTHER PUBLIC SERVANT SHALL COLLECT THE DNA SAMPLE.
   43    S 3. Section 65.10 of the penal law is amended by adding a new  subdi-
   44  vision 4-b to read as follows:
   45    4-B.  MANDATORY  DNA  CONDITION  FOR  DESIGNATED OFFENDERS AND CERTAIN
   46  OTHER OFFENDERS. WHEN IMPOSING A SENTENCE OF  PROBATION  OR  CONDITIONAL
   47  DISCHARGE  UPON  A  PERSON  DEFINED AS A DESIGNATED OFFENDER PURSUANT TO
   48  SUBDIVISION SEVEN OF SECTION NINE HUNDRED NINETY-FIVE OF  THE  EXECUTIVE
   49  LAW,  THE  COURT SHALL REQUIRE AS A MANDATORY CONDITION OF SUCH SENTENCE
   50  THAT SUCH PERSON PROVIDE A  DNA  SAMPLE  AS  REQUIRED  BY  SECTION  NINE
   51  HUNDRED  NINETY-FIVE  OF THE EXECUTIVE LAW.  NOTHING IN THIS SUBDIVISION
   52  SHALL BE CONSTRUED AS PROHIBITING A DNA CONDITION UPON ANY OTHER  OFFEN-
   53  DER WHERE AUTHORIZED BY ARTICLE FORTY-NINE-B OF THE EXECUTIVE LAW.
   54    S  4.  The penal law is amended by adding a new section 270.40 to read
   55  as follows:
   56  S 270.40 FAILURE TO PROVIDE A DNA SAMPLE.

       S. 693                              5

    1    A PERSON IS GUILTY OF FAILURE TO PROVIDE A DNA SAMPLE WHEN HE  OR  SHE
    2  (A) IS A DESIGNATED OFFENDER, AS DEFINED IN SUBDIVISION SEVEN OF SECTION
    3  NINE  HUNDRED  NINETY-FIVE  OF  THE EXECUTIVE LAW, REQUIRED TO PROVIDE A
    4  SAMPLE APPROPRIATE FOR DNA TESTING PURSUANT TO THE PROVISIONS OF  SUBDI-
    5  VISION THREE OF SECTION NINE HUNDRED NINETY-FIVE-C OF THE EXECUTIVE LAW;
    6  (B)  HAS BEEN NOTIFIED BY A COURT, STATE OR LOCAL CORRECTION OFFICIAL OR
    7  EMPLOYEE, PAROLE OFFICER, PROBATION OFFICER, POLICE OFFICER, PEACE OFFI-
    8  CER OR OTHER PUBLIC SERVANT OF THE OBLIGATION TO PROVIDE SUCH A  SAMPLE;
    9  AND  (C)  UPON  REQUEST  TO PROVIDE SUCH SAMPLE MADE BY A PUBLIC SERVANT
   10  AUTHORIZED TO COLLECT IT, FAILS TO PROVIDE SUCH A SAMPLE.
   11    FAILURE TO PROVIDE A DNA SAMPLE IS A CLASS A MISDEMEANOR.
   12    S 5. The sum of four hundred thousand dollars ($400,000), or  so  much
   13  thereof  as  may be necessary, is hereby appropriated to the division of
   14  criminal justice services and the division of state police  out  of  any
   15  monies  of  the  state treasury in the general fund to the credit of the
   16  state purposes account, not otherwise appropriated, for the  purpose  of
   17  carrying out the provisions of this act. Such monies shall be made paya-
   18  ble on the audit and warrant of the comptroller.
   19    S  6.  This  act shall take effect January 1, 2012; provided, however,
   20  that the amendments to subdivision 7 of section 995 of the executive law
   21  made by section one of this  act  shall  apply  to  designated  offenses
   22  committed  on  or  after such effective date; and provided, further that
   23  the amendments to subdivision 7 of section 995 of the executive law made
   24  by section one of this act relating to  a  person  who  is  required  to
   25  register  as  a sex offender pursuant to article six-C of the correction
   26  law shall apply to a person registered as a sex offender prior  to,  on,
   27  or after such effective date.
